meteringrange: 0 to 20 EV (Matrix or center-weighted metering) 2 to 20 EV (spot metering)
exposurebracketing: 2-5 frames in steps of 1/3, 2/3, 1, 2, or 3 EV
isosensitivity: Lowest Standard ISO Sensitivity: 100 Highest Standard ISO Sensitivity: 12,800 Lowest Expanded ISO Sensitivity: 50 Highest Expanded ISO Sensitivity: 204,800
lenscompatibilityataglance: AF-S or AF lenses fully compatibleMetering with AI lenses
monitor: Monitor Size: 3.2 inch diagonal Monitor Resolution: 921K dot Monitor Type: Wide Viewing Angle TFT-LCD Monitor Angle of View: 170-degree wide-viewing angle Monitor Adjustments: Brightness, 5 levels
focuslock: Focus can be locked by pressing AE-L/AF-L button Focus can be locked by pressing shutter-release button halfway (single-servo AF)
compatiblelenses: Compatible with AF NIKKOR lenses, including type G, E, and D lenses (some restrictions apply to PC lenses) and DX lenses (using DX 24 x 16 1.5x image area), AI-P NIKKOR lenses, and non-CPU lenses.
expandedisosensitivityoptions: Hi-1 (ISO-25,600 equivalent) Hi-2, (ISO-51,200 equivalent) Hi-3, (ISO-102,400 equivalent) Hi-4 (ISO-204,800 equivalent)
exposurelock: Luminosity locked at detected value with A AE-L/AF-L button
selftimer: 2 s, 5 s, 10 s, 20 s; 1-9 exposures at intervals of 0.5, 1, 2, or 3 s
flashcontrol: TTL: i-TTL flash control using 2,016-pixel RGB sensor is available with SB-910, SB-900, SB-800, SB-700, SB-600, SB-400, or T103; i-TTL balanced fill-flash for digital SLR is used with matrix and center-weighted metering, standard i-TTL flash for digital SLR with spot metering
autofocussystem: Nikon Multi-CAM 4800 autofocus sensor module with TTL phase detection, fine-tuning, and 39 focus points (including 9 cross-type sensors; the center 33 points are available at apertures slower than f/5.6 and faster than f/8, while the center 7 focus points are available at f/8)
focusmodes: Auto AF-S/AF-C selection (AF-A) Single-servo AF (AF-S); Continuous-servo (AF-C) Face-Priority AF, Normal area, Wide area and Subject tracking AF available in Live View only Full-time Servo (AF-F) available in Live View only Manual (M) with electronic rangefinder
interface: HDMI output: Type C mini-pin HDMI connector Hi-speed USB
shutterspeed: 1/4000-4 s in steps of 1 EV (1/4000-30 s in steps of 1/3 EV with main command dial), bulb, time, X200
depthoffieldcontrol: Pressing Pv button stops lens aperture down to value selected by user (exposure modes A and M) or by camera (exposure modes P and S)
flashbracketing: 2-5 frames in steps of 1/3, 2/3, 1, 2, or 3 EV
afareamode: 9, 21 or 39 point Dynamic-area AF Auto-area AF Single-point AF 3D-tracking (39 points)
viewfindereyepoint: 15 mm ( 1.0 m 1; from center surface of viewfinder eyepiece lens)
meteringmethod: Center-weighted: Weight of 75% given to 12 mm circle in center of frame Matrix: 3D color matrix metering II (type G, E and D lenses); color matrix metering II (other CPU lenses) Spot: Meters 4 mm circle (about 1.5% of frame) centered on selected focus point
liveviewafareamode: Face-priority AF Wide-area AF Normal-area AF Subject-tracking AF
focusingscreen: Type B BriteView Clear Matte Mark VIII screen with AF area brackets (framing grid can be displayed)
storagemedia: SD (Secure Digital) and UHS-I compliant SDHC and SDXC memory cards
supportedlanguages: Arabic Chinese (Simplified and Traditional) Czech Danish Dutch English Finnish French German Indonesian Italian Japanese Korean Norweigan Polish Portuguese Romanian Russian Spanish Swedish Thai Turkish Ukrainian
exposuremeteringsystem: TTL exposure metering using 2,016-pixel RGB sensor
liveviewlensservo: Autofocus (AF): Single-servo AF (AF-S); full-time-servo AF (AF-F) Manual focus (MF)
exposuremetercoupling: Combined CPU and AI (collapsible meter coupling lever)
liveviewautofocus: Contrast-detect AF anywhere in frame (camera selects focus point automatically when face-priority AF or subject-tracking AF is selected)
picturecontrol: Vivid Landscape Monochrome Neutral Portrait Standard User-customizable Settings
playbackfunctions: Full-frame and thumbnail (4, 9, or 72 images or calendar) playback with playback zoom, photo slide shows, histogram display, highlights, photo information, location data display, and auto image rotation
shutterreleasemodes: Single-frame [S]; Continuous low-speed [CL]; Continuous high-speed [CH]; Mirror-up [Mup]; Quiet Shutter Release; Self-timer
lensservo: Autofocus (AF): Single-servo AF (AF-S); Continuous-servo AF (AF-C); predictive focus tracking activated automatically according to subject status Manual focus (MF): Electronic rangefinder can be used
flashcompensation: -3- +1 EV in increments of 1/3 or 1/2 EV
activedlighting: Can be selected from Auto, Extra high +2/+1, High, Normal, Low, or Off
viewfinderframecoverage: FX (36x24): 100% Horizontal and 100% Vertical (Approx.) DX (24x16): 97% Horizontal and 97% Vertical (Approx.)
flashsyncmodes: Front curtain sync, slow sync, rear-curtain sync, red-eye reduction, red-eye reduction with slow sync, slow rearcurtain sync, Auto FP High-Speed Sync supported
acadapter: EH-5b AC adapter; requires EP-5A power connector (available separately)
exposuremodes: Programmed auto with flexible program (P); shutter- priority auto (S); aperture-priority auto (A); manual (M)
dlightingbracketing: 2 frames using selected value for one frame or 3-5 frames using preset values for all frames
filesystem: Compliant with DCF (Design Rule for Camera File System) 2.0 DPOF (Digital Print Order Format) EXIF 2.3 (Exchangeable Image File Format for Digital Still Cameras) PictBridge
whitebalance: Auto (2 types) Choose color temperature (2500K-10000K) Cloudy Direct Sunlight Flash Fluorescent (7 types) Incandescent Preset manual (up to 4 values can be stored) Shade
